Singer-turned-actor Kim Hyun-joong is considering a return to the small screen, his agency said on Tuesday. According to KeyEast Entertainment, Kim recently received an offer to star in the upcoming 12-episode fantasy romance drama "When Time Stopped," in which he would play a time traveler living a solitary life. KeyEast said Kim has not yet decided whether to accept the offer. His last screen appearance was in the 2014 TV series "Inspiring Generation." As part of the LifeMedGreenRoof project, the Standards and Metrology Institute within the Malta Competition and Consumer Affairs Authority (MCCAA) hosted the second workshop, launching a public consultation on the draft National Green Roof Standard. As part of the EU 2020 Strategy, which aims to reduce energy demands by at least 20% by 2020, the European Commission's 2011 Energy Efficiency Plan identified buildings as having the greatest energy-saving potential. The plan focuses on mechanisms to reduce energy demands in existing buildings, particularly public buildings, and the role of projects in promoting energy efficiency measures. The European Commission's plan aims to achieve the objectives of the 2020 Strategy, reducing energy consumption and promoting sustainable development. The workshop hosted by the MCCAA's Standards and Metrology Institute is part of this objective, aiming to reduce energy demands in Maltese buildings and promote sustainable development in Malta through the promotion of green roof technology. The workshop hosted by the Maltese Standards and Metrology Institute is part of this objective, aiming to reduce energy demands in Maltese buildings and promote sustainable development in Malta through the promotion of green roof technology.

Voter fraud cases have been confirmed in multiple states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's top election official is warning residents about a potential scam targeting sensitive information from potential voters, after similar concerns arose in several other states. The scam involves a caller claiming to work for a voter registration assistance organization. The caller offers to register residents over the phone and, in some cases, send absentee ballots to voters, according to Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin. Under state law, residents cannot register for voting or request absentee ballots over the phone.

For small businesses that operate on credit, accounts receivable can make up a large portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, the auditor will verify that your claims about accounts receivable balances are substantiated. These claims are called assertions. The most common audit procedure for accounts receivable is confirmation, in which the auditor will ask your customers to confirm their account balances. Understanding which assertions can be confirmed through confirmation can help you understand why your auditor may need to perform multiple audit procedures on the same account. Accounts receivable confirmation is primarily used to substantiate existence assertions.

This kind of thing happens often: you press the snooze button on your alarm once, twice, or even three times, so when you finally get washed up, dressed, and ready to face the new day, you're already behind schedule. Usually, this results in you completely skipping breakfast. It turns out that your breakfast habits are a time-saving method that should not be ignored. Firstly, eating a nutritious, high-protein, and balanced breakfast every morning has been proven to be an effective way to activate the brain, improve focus, and performance. Additionally, eating breakfast is also associated with better weight control, as it provides energy for the body and may reduce hunger later in the day.

Dublin: Lawmakers voted overwhelmingly in favor of Ireland's first abortion bill on Friday, which allows for the termination of pregnancy under certain circumstances, when a pregnancy poses a risk to a woman's life, marking a major step forward for the predominantly Catholic country in relaxing its blanket ban on abortion. Exhausted lawmakers applauded the 127-31 vote result on Friday, while abortion rights activists cheered as they watched the result on their phones outside the parliament gates. The vote ended a grueling debate that began on Wednesday morning and continued until 5am on Thursday, with a brief recess, and resumed until midnight on Friday. The lawmakers finally passed the bill, which will allow for abortion under certain circumstances.

VOLGOGRAD, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try to defy the sweltering heat of Volgograd when they face Nigeria on Friday in their second World Cup match, after impressively holding two-time champions Argentina to a draw. The World Cup debutants, who are dreaming of advancing to the knockout stage and writing a new chapter in one of the greatest stories in international football in recent years, will attempt to do so. However, standing in their way is not only Nigeria, who desperately need a win after losing 0-2 to Croatia in their opening game, but also the challenge posed by the scorching weather of the southern Russian city of Volgograd.

A pair of thieves in the Greater Vancouver area have been arrested and charged in connection with a long-standing mail and identity theft. According to a press release issued by the RCMP in Courtenay on November 11, the Courtenay RCMP and Canada Post investigators collaborated on an investigation into the thefts, identifying and arresting the main suspect, and obtaining a large amount of evidence through search warrants. Heine Hut, a 49-year-old man from Surrey with a prior record, faces six charges, including mail theft, unauthorized use of a mail key, possession of stolen mail, and possession of a stolen credit card.

We first looked at which big brands had the most expensive maintenance costs over the first 10 years of a car's life. We grouped all models by brand and year to calculate the average cost per brand. To estimate annual maintenance costs, we found the maintenance cost of every other oil change (since oil changes are typically done every six months). It's no surprise that German imports led the list by a wide margin. Toyota, and its two brands Lexus and Scion, were among the cheapest brands, with owners saving at least $10,000 in maintenance costs over 10 years compared to BMW.

Aurora, Illinois - A suburban boy died after a tragic accident in a high school parking lot. Authorities said 17-year-old Stephen Woodcock, of St. Charles, died Monday morning, May 16, 2016, from head injuries in the Marmion Academy parking lot. According to police, the teen was riding on the passenger-side running board of an SUV, lost his grip, and fell backward, hitting his head on the pavement, as reported by WGN. Police said Woodcock suffered injuries to his head and other areas. After being treated by paramedics at the scene, he was airlifted to a hospital.

The district representatives of the Fiji Council of Social Services (FCOSS) yesterday approved the Fiji Civil Society Organisations (CSO) Accountability Framework in Lautoka, which is expected to be implemented in January 2019. FCOSS chief executive officer Vani Catanasiga said nearly 50 representatives from the district social services committees (DCOSS) of Lami, Suva, Nadi, Nadroga, Lautoka, Savusavu, Labasa and Rakiraki, passed the accountability framework after a two-day meeting in Lautoka.

Veteran congressman Jim Leach, a Republican from Iowa, lost his seat in the 2006 elections. I'm not defending "moderate Republicans" per se, but it's worth mentioning! In my view, Leach was absolutely the best Republican in the House. Nevertheless, one can only be glad about his defeat. In fact, the very occurrence of this event only shows how bad the entire Republican Party has become. Leach was a person with genuinely good instincts and some basically correct ideas about how the US should conduct itself in the world, but he was useless in practice.

Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's anti-harassment rules. On Monday, after Trump tweeted that North Korea might not "be around much longer," Twitter was forced to explain why it hadn't banned the president from the service. Twitter's public policy account posted a thread of six tweets, in which the company said it considers "newsworthiness" and "public interest" when determining whether a user has violated its rules. Twitter said these considerations have long been used internally to decide the fate of problematic accounts. The company said its rules are intended to ensure that all users can use the service safely, but it also considers whether certain tweets have news value or serve the public interest. In this case, Twitter deemed Trump's tweet, although controversial, to be of news value and in the public interest, and therefore took no action.

After two months of synchronized growth at the beginning of the year, Summit County's real estate sales declined in March, resulting in a noticeable decline in first-quarter numbers, according to a report by Slifer Smith & Frampton. The high-country real estate giant tracks various statistics in the local market, and according to the company's latest market report, Summit County saw a 12 percent decline in the number and total dollar volume of real estate transactions in the first three months of 2018 compared to the first quarter of 2017.

Casey Brumbeloe, a senior at Stanhope Elmore High School, has been selected as a member of the Alabama State Department of Education's Student Advisory Council. Casey was one of 16 middle and high school students chosen from 80 applicants. The selection committee that reviewed student applications included representatives from the Alabama State Department of Education, CLAS, AASB, A+ Education Partnership, and the 2015-2016 Alabama Teacher of the Year. Students were selected based on their level of leadership in their schools and letters of recommendation. Council members will meet twice during the school year with State Superintendent of Education Dr. Tommy Bice.

South Bend, Indiana -- The Irish took to the practice field for the final time on Thursday morning ahead of the Blue Gold Game on Saturday. One of the biggest questions the team faced when spring practice began still doesn't have an answer: who will emerge at the outside linebacker position? Defensive coordinator Clark Lea said fifth-year outside linebacker Asmar Bilal is currently the closest to being "solid" in the unit, but he seems content with the uncertainty. He believes the position has made huge strides over the past month and a half, but with a couple of months still to go before Week 1, he's not in a rush to have everything settled. Despite not having made a decision at the position, Lea is pleased with the progress the team has made and is confident they'll find the right guy over the next couple of months.

It's difficult to exaggerate Amazon's success and its growing influence. Amazon's market value is hovering around $1 trillion. Their growth rate is astonishing. According to most estimates, Amazon currently accounts for nearly 50% of e-commerce sales in the US, about 5% of all retail sales, and is larger than the sum of its next 10 largest competitors. A study found that about 55% of online product searches start on Amazon. This week, a report that Amazon is considering opening up to 3,000 cashier-less convenience stores - Amazon Go - by 2021, drew a lot of attention, even though they just opened their fourth location a few days ago.

New York - A lawyer who was filmed berating staff in Spanish at a New York City restaurant issued an apology on Tuesday. "To the people I insulted, I apologize," he said. "Seeing myself in the video online was a wake-up call - the way I expressed myself was unacceptable and it's not the real me. I see that my words and actions hurt people and I'm truly sorry. While people should be able to express themselves freely, they should do so in a calm and respectful manner. The video didn't show the real me, and I'm not a racist.

Some of the widgets are cool, some are funny... and some are just plain weird. The town of South Upi is being plagued by a terror incident involving residents of Bataraza town in Palawan province, which is not attributed to extremists but to politicians. Residents are calling on the government for help to prevent another attack on their island community, which a resident claimed was due to their refusal to support the re-election bid of incumbent Mayor Anton Burahan. Bidding Jubair, a 60-year-old resident of Bataraza, said "we were helpless" as he recalled the January 2 attack on the island town, allegedly by Burahan's supporters, who used M203 grenade launchers and M-14 and M-16 rifles. The residents blamed the attack on their refusal to support Burahan's re-election.

German business confidence plummeted in October to its lowest level in two and a half years, marking the sixth consecutive month of decline, eliminating any doubt that Europe's largest economy is being affected by the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo think tank said on Wednesday that its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of more than 7,000 companies, fell to 100.0 in October from 101.4 in September. "The shadows over the German economy are growing darker," said Hans-Werner Sinn, president of the Ifo Institute. The euro fell to a one-week low against the dollar and European stocks turned negative after the Ifo data was released.

The life of the mind has always been a puzzle to poets and neuroscientists, who try to map and mark it, while for me it's about searching for it. In Irish tradition, thinking itself is something to think about, so there are many concepts in the Irish language that involve the mind, dreams, and imagination. As a student, many nuances are still unclear to me, but language is about conversation. I would love to hear more mature insights from native speakers about the vocabulary related to thought in Irish.

New Delhi: The below-normal monsoon forecast by private weather agency Skymet had a significant impact on the stock benchmarks on Wednesday, causing the stock benchmarks to give up their gains for the day after hitting new historic highs. According to Skymet, the 2019 monsoon is likely to be "below normal", with a long period average (LPA) of 887 mm for the four months (June to September), expected to be only 93%. Los Angeles - A proposal to grant subpoena power to a oversight commission that oversees the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department was to be put to a vote by voters in March 2020. The proposal failed to gain approval from the board of supervisors today. Supporters of the "Reform LA Jails" initiative collected nearly 250,000 signatures in support of the measure, which would also require a civilian oversight commission to study ways to reduce the county's jail population and divert jail construction funds to alternative incarceration methods. Supervisor Sheila Kuehl said the issue should be put to a vote by the county's more than 10 million residents. The board of supervisors failed to approve the proposal, so it will be put to a vote by voters. Supporters of the initiative collected enough signatures to put the issue to a vote.

Hertfordshire Baseball Club has been awarded a £10,000 grant from Sport England to open a new branch of the club in North West London and provide the local community with the opportunity to play baseball. Hertfordshire Baseball Club has been based at Grove Hill Baseball Field in Hemel Hempstead since its formation in 1996. Over the years, the club has grown to become one of the largest baseball clubs in the UK, with eight teams competing in various adult and youth leagues managed by the British Baseball Federation. In 2013, the club realized the need to expand to accommodate the increasing number of new players.

The Israeli military shot a Palestinian teenager at a checkpoint in the occupied West Bank. Egypt has been trying to broker a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, the Palestinian organization that has de facto control over Gaza, in an effort to prevent an escalation of violent incidents near the Gaza border. The airstrikes came shortly after Israeli troops shot dead a 16-year-old boy near the city of Nablus. Israeli military spokeswoman Michal Ya'akov said that on Monday, a man acted suspiciously at the Hawara checkpoint, leading soldiers to suspect he was carrying explosive devices.

Ottawa, March 20 (Reuters) - The government of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau faced a new blow on Wednesday as a legislator quit his ruling Liberal Party to sit as an independent in parliament, the latest fallout from a political scandal that has plagued the prime minister since February 7. Trudeau has been defending himself over accusations that his staff pressured former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to ensure that construction company SNC-Lavalin Group Inc. avoided a bribery trial. The political crisis threatens the government's chances of winning an election scheduled for this October.

On Friday, the Supreme Court directed the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to review a proposal by the Agra Municipal Corporation to set up a waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur landfill site. Agra falls within the Taj Trapezium Zone, an area of 10,400 square kilometers that spans the districts of Firozabad, Mathura, Hathras, and Etah in Uttar Pradesh and Bharatpur in Rajasthan. As the urban local body, the Agra Municipal Corporation had approached the Supreme Court seeking permission to set up the waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur landfill site. The Supreme Court has now directed NEERI and CPCB to review the proposal. The Taj Trapezium Zone is a specially designated environmental protection area aimed at protecting historic buildings like the Taj Mahal from pollution. The Supreme Court has asked NEERI and CPCB to assess the proposal and consider the environmental protection requirements of the Taj Trapezium Zone. Environmental protection efforts in the Taj Trapezium Zone are crucial for preserving historic buildings and promoting sustainable development in the region.

Then, on Friday, a teenage girl was reportedly bitten by a baby rattlesnake in a residential area in the Clayton community, which is near Mount Diablo State Park. Washington D.C., July 31, 2018/3:01 pm - The U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit ruled on Tuesday that the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority has the right to ban religious-themed advertisements from the Archdiocese of Washington. In November 2015, the Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority issued 14 new advertising guidelines for its buses and trains. Guideline 12 explicitly prohibited advertisements that "promote or oppose any religion, religious practice or belief". The new guidelines were issued after someone attempted to purchase an ad featuring an image of Muhammad.

The concert, themed "Discovering Jazz", will take the audience through the evolution of jazz from the early 20th century to the present. Under the direction of conductor Christopher Dorsey, the jazz ensemble took first place at the prestigious Ellington High School Jazz Competition and Festival in New York City this year, one of the most renowned high school jazz competitions in the nation. The ensemble also took first place at the Swing Central competition in Savannah, Georgia.

Maureen Wilkes believes it's time to understand the true impact of the Vietnam War on the children of veterans. Like many other children of veterans, I was just a statistic. If this study had been done years ago, perhaps it would have been so, perhaps I would have been aware of what was happening to me, not to mention what was happening to my father. Hello, I am the wife of a Vietnam veteran and I have three children. My first daughter was born when I was 18 in my first marriage, then I had two more daughters in my second marriage in 1970.

Albany - New York Governor Andrew Cuomo, who has more than 863,000 followers across two Twitter accounts, called the popular social media site an "elite bulletin board" on Tuesday and said he doesn't look at it. "We've created an echo chamber for the elites to talk to themselves in a small bubble, where an unrealistic world exists that thinks it represents the entire world, but actually restricts political wisdom and thought," he said in an interview with WAMC radio. Cuomo has two Twitter accounts, one with 853,000 followers and another with 10,400 followers. He said that during his re-election campaign last year, reporters told him to follow trends on Twitter.

Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif met with Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan at the Prime Minister's Office on Friday, with both sides emphasizing the need to promote bilateral relations in all areas of cooperation. According to Radio Pakistan, Prime Minister Imran Khan stated that Pakistan and Iran are key to regional growth and prosperity, which can be achieved by enhancing connectivity and promoting people-to-people exchanges. The Prime Minister thanked the Iranian Supreme Leader for his support for the Kashmiri people's right to self-determination. Zarif conveyed a message from Iranian President Hassan Rouhani, inviting the Prime Minister to attend the Asian Cooperation Dialogue Summit to be held in Iran in October this year.

Without a doubt, the addiction drama 'Beautiful Boy' - not the horror film 'Halloween' - is the most frightening movie of the weekend. Starring Steve Carell and Timothée Chalamet, the film depicts a young man's descent into methamphetamine addiction (as well as heroin, pills, and marijuana) in a haunting and unsettling manner, as well as the efforts of a devoted father to save him. It's a true and terrifying story that not even mediocre direction and clichéd writing can diminish its impact.

Shiv Sena party chief Uddhav Thackeray urged Union Agriculture Minister and Nationalist Congress Party leader Sharad Pawar to resign from the Union Cabinet and return to Maharashtra to protect the interests of drought-affected farmers. After visiting the family of farmer Gajanan Ghotekar, who had recently committed suicide, Thackeray told the media yesterday that he had appealed to farmers not to vote for the Nationalist Congress Party and the Congress. Uddhav met the family of the deceased farmer and although he did not provide immediate financial assistance, he promised to take care of the children's education. Thackeray said that Ghotekar had blamed the Congress and the Nationalist Congress Party in his suicide note for the farmers' plight. Thackeray accused the Congress and the Nationalist Congress Party of being responsible for the farmers' plight and appealed to farmers not to support them anymore.

Recent studies have shown that dementia patients can benefit greatly from participating in art therapy. While many people believe that a healthy diet and exercise are key to healthy aging, the International Journal of Geriatric Psychiatry found that certain personality traits can also have a huge impact on your life as you age. We all lead busy lives, but if you've recently moved into an assisted living house or memory care cottage, it's even more important to stay in touch with loved ones. Nutrition is important for everyone, but it's especially crucial for older adults.

The unemployment rate in Stark County fell to 6.8% in August, the lowest since September 2008. Stark County's unemployment rate was below 7% for the first time since 2008, and there are several reasons for the decline. The most likely reason is the oil and gas drilling in the Utica Shale, which has brought a surge of businesses to the area. Oil exploration companies arrived first, followed by engineering and construction companies that provide a variety of services. Manufacturing has also experienced growth due to increased demand for steel and drilling equipment from both local and national sources.

Recent research has shown that after inducing Alzheimer's-like symptoms in mice, their cognitive function improved after receiving synthetic estrogen-like hormones. A police officer has been dismissed due to his actions in a relationship with his partner. A Northamptonshire police officer was dismissed after choking his girlfriend in her bedroom and threatening to "kill her". At a misconduct hearing into the officer's behavior, the 28-year-old woman told the panel that Mead was violent towards her on multiple occasions when he lost his temper while they were together. The hearing was told that Mead choked his former partner in her bedroom and threatened to kill her. The incident reportedly took place in early 2018, but Mead's former partner did not report it to the police until a year later.

Omaha, Nebraska - Deverell Biggs, a University of Nebraska men's basketball player, was ticketed for allegedly driving drunk and leaving the scene of an accident. According to a police report, Biggs backed his Chevrolet Suburban into a car belonging to a Bellevue man at 1:35 a.m. Sunday and left after a brief conversation with the other driver. Police stopped Biggs a few miles away and he was found to have a blood-alcohol level of 0.134, above the legal limit of 0.08. Biggs, 20, was also cited for minor in possession of alcohol and unsafe backing.

Harrisburg, Pennsylvania -- The Pennsylvania Auditor General's office announced it will be granting over $55 million to thousands of volunteer fire departments. Officials say the funding will be allocated based on population and the number of volunteer fire departments. All 66 counties in the state, except for Philadelphia, will receive funding, with each county in northeastern and central Pennsylvania receiving at least $57,000. Luzerne County will receive the largest amount: $1.1 million. The Harvey's Lake Volunteer Fire Department, located in the Back Mountain area of Luzerne County, has volunteers dispatched around the clock to various locations throughout the county.

Brazil is now implementing the "Brasil Sem Miséria" program, a continuation of the successful "Fome Zero" program, according to Marques Porto. In 2003, former President Lula da Silva launched the "Fome Zero" program, which is credited with lifting 30 to 40 million Brazilians out of poverty. One of the core actions of the program was to provide free school meals to poor children, which were purchased by the government from family farms. This practice not only supported local small farmers, but also provided high-quality nutrition to children from low-income families.

The Russian data center market is experiencing continuous growth, which can be seen from the significant increase in the number of operating facilities. It is no longer surprising for consumers to see data centers that occupy several thousand square meters and have 1,000 or more racks - these have become common. According to data provided by Datacenter Dynamics, over the past two years, the Russian data center market has led in terms of total investment, surpassing India, China, and Brazil. Similarly, according to the latest construction data for the same period, Russia ranks second in terms of total area among BRICS countries, only behind Brazil.

Geneva - The head of the United Nations fact-finding mission on the Gaza conflict, Judge Richard Goldstone, today urged the international community to take action to end the impunity of Israel and the occupied Palestinian territory for violations of international law, as he presented the mission's report to the Human Rights Council. After a three-month investigation, the four-member mission concluded that Israel's military operations in Gaza from December 27, 2008, to January 18, 2009, seriously violated international human rights and humanitarian law, and that Israel's actions constituted war crimes and possibly crimes against humanity. The mission's report also found that Hamas had attacked civilians, in violation of international humanitarian law. Judge Goldstone emphasized that the international community must take action to hold Israel and Hamas accountable and ensure justice for victims.

Oden Technologies is a startup tech company that aims to make factories smarter through its big data and Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) platform.
